note.desc: According to local tradition, the foundation took place during the time of King ʿAmdä Ṣǝyon I (r. 1314-44).
note.ab: Däbr. Formerly, the church could have a different name, cp. GSM-002, Zäg(g)abo/Zäg(g)abu Maryam. Currently, the site accomodates two churches. The recent (late 19th or 20th cent.?), rectangular church dedicated to Kidanä Mǝḥrät stands below, and the old rock-hewn church dedicated to St. Mary is located above, cut in the rock. Many holes and small caves can be seen in the vertical rock around its entrance, formerly used as burials (in a few of them wooden caffins could still be seen) or dwellings of the monks.
